blockquote.blockquote: The array created by this constructor has a length equal to the value of the argument. The elements of the array are constructed using the default constructor for the instantiating type T.

discussion.p: The problem is that the most obvious Ts for valarray are float and double, they don't have a default constructor. I guess the intent is to value-initialize the elements, so I suggest replacing:
discussion.blockquote: The elements of the array are constructed using the default constructor for the instantiating type T.
The elements of the array are value-initialized.
discussion.p: There is another reference to the default constructor of T in the non-normative note in paragraph 9. That reference should also be replaced. (The normative wording in paragraph 8 refers to T() and so it doesn't need changes).
discussion.blockquote: We agree with the proposed resolution. Move to NAD Editorial.

blockquote.blockquote: The array created by this constructor has a length equal to the value of the argument. The elements of the array are constructed using the default constructor for the instantiating type T value-initialized ().

resolution.blockquote: [Example: If the argument has the value -2, the first two elements of the result will be constructed using the default constructor value-initialized (); the third element of the result will be assigned the value of the first element of the argument; etc. -- end example]
